subject: Travel
title: Russian Hospitality Rules
description: A micro-lesson that makes Russian Hospitality Rules usable.

hook.text: In Russia, you must remove your shoes the moment you enter someone's home. The host will offer slippers.

buildup.text: Bringing an odd number of flowers is essential. Even numbers are reserved strictly for funerals.

discovery.text: Refusing food at a Russian table is nearly impossible. Hosts will keep offering until you physically can't eat.

twist.text: An empty plate means you're still hungry. Leave a little food to show you've been well fed.

climax.text: Toasting is an art. Each toast must be unique, personal, and heartfelt. Repeating a toast is frowned upon.

punchline.text: In Russia, the meal doesn't end until you surrender.

quiz.question: Why must flowers given in Russia be an odd number?
options: Even numbers are reserved for funerals
